description.zh-cn: 一所专为中国陆军留学生开办的预科军事学校，为日本陆军参谋本部支持的民办学校。其毕业生对中国近代历史产生重要影响。
description.en: A private preparatory military school for Chinese army students studying abroad, supported by the Japanese Army General Staff. Its graduates had a significant impact on modern Chinese history.

description.zh-cn: 东京振武学校的前身机构，由日高藤吉郎和河村隆实创办，旨在为有志报考陆军士官学校的青年提供培训。
description.en: The predecessor institution of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō, founded by Hidaka Tōkichirō and Kawamura Takami to train young men aspiring to enter the Army Academy.

description.zh-cn: 日本旧士族，于1885年与河村隆实共同创办了成城学校的前身“文武讲习馆”。
description.en: A former samurai from Japan who, along with Kawamura Takami, co-founded the 'Bunbu Kōshūkan,' the predecessor to Seijō Gakkō, in 1885.

description.zh-cn: 日本旧士族，于1885年与日高藤吉郎共同创办了成城学校的前身“文武讲习馆”。
description.en: A former samurai from Japan who, along with Hidaka Tōkichirō, co-founded the 'Bunbu Kōshūkan,' the predecessor to Seijō Gakkō, in 1885.

en: Imperial Japanese Army General Staff Office

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军的最高军事指挥机构，支持了东京振武学校的创办和运营。
description.en: The supreme military command body of the Imperial Japanese Army, which supported the establishment and operation of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军参谋本部高官，曾担任成城学校校长。
description.en: A high-ranking officer of the Japanese Army General Staff who served as the principal of Seijō Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军参谋本部高官，曾担任成城学校校长。
description.en: A high-ranking officer of the Japanese Army General Staff who served as the principal of Seijō Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 日本的军事院校，东京振武学校的毕业生可以进入该校的留学生班就读。
description.en: A Japanese military academy where graduates of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō could enroll in the international student class.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军参谋本部第二部部长，曾向清政府游说军事留学的重要性，并协助创办了东京振武学校。
description.en: Director of the Second Department of the Japanese Army General Staff, who lobbied the Qing government on the importance of military studies abroad and helped establish the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 在清朝留学生与驻日公使馆发生冲突后，出面斡旋并协助成立了东京振武学校。
description.en: After a conflict arose between Qing dynasty students and the legation in Japan, this organization mediated and assisted in the establishment of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 清末湖广总督，于1898年选送学生入成城学校学习军事。
description.en: Viceroy of Huguang in the late Qing Dynasty who selected students to study military science at Seijō Gakkō in 1898.

description.zh-cn: 清末南洋大臣，于1899年开始选派留学生入成城学校学习。
description.en: Viceroy of Liangjiang in the late Qing Dynasty who began sending students to Seijō Gakkō in 1899.

description.zh-cn: 清末四川总督，于1899年开始选派留学生入成城学校学习。
description.en: Viceroy of Sichuan in the late Qing Dynasty who began sending students to Seijō Gakkō in 1899.

description.zh-cn: 清末直隶总督，于1899年开始选派留学生入成城学校学习。
description.en: Viceroy of Zhili in the late Qing Dynasty who began sending students to Seijō Gakkō in 1899.

description.zh-cn: 自费就读成城学校的中国留学生，其与清朝驻日公使蔡钧的冲突事件是东京振武学校建立的直接导火索。
description.en: A self-funded Chinese student at Seijō Gakkō, whose conflict with the Qing minister to Japan, Cai Jun, directly triggered the establishment of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 清朝驻日公使，因拒绝为钮瑷等自费留学生在担保书上盖章而引发激烈对抗。
description.en: The Qing dynasty's minister to Japan, who sparked intense confrontation by refusing to stamp the guarantee documents for self-funded students like Niu Ai.

description.zh-cn: 位于东京振武学校旧址的大学。
description.en: A university located at the former site of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 前中华民国总统，东京振武学校的知名校友。
description.en: Former President of the Republic of China, a notable alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 清末宗社党领袖之一，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Royalist Party in the late Qing Dynasty, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国初年军事家，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A military strategist in the early Republic of China, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代史学家、政治活动家，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A modern Chinese historian and political activist, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党主要创始人之一，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: One of the main founders of the Communist Party of China, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代戏剧家，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A modern Chinese dramatist, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命元勋，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A veteran of the 1911 Revolution, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家和教育家，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary and educator, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中国军事人物，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A Chinese military figure, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期政治人物，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A political figure during the Republic of China period, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 滇系军阀首领，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: Leader of the Yunnan clique of warlords, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军一级上将，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A general in the army of the Republic of China, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 湘系军阀的领导人之一，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Hunan clique of warlords, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A military strategist of the Republic of China, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 直系军阀首领之一，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Zhili clique of warlords, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命武昌起义领导人之一，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Wuchang Uprising during the 1911 Revolution, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军二级上将，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A second-class general in the army of the Republic of China, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 晋系军阀首领，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: Leader of the Shanxi clique of warlords, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A military general of the Republic of China, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A political figure of the Republic of China, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事人物，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A military figure of the Republic of China, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中国军事人物，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A Chinese military figure, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A political figure of the Republic of China, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 奉系军阀将领，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A general of the Fengtian clique of warlords, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 奉系军阀高级将领，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A high-ranking general of the Fengtian clique of warlords, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 满洲国政治人物，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A political figure of Manchukuo, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军一级上将，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A first-class general in the army of the Republic of China, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国及满洲国军事、政治人物，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A military and political figure of the Republic of China and Manchukuo, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代作家、诗人、翻译家，东京振武学校校友。
description.en: A modern Chinese writer, poet, and translator, an alumnus of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 1885年，日高藤吉郎与河村隆实共同创办了成城学校的前身“文武讲习馆”。
description.en: In 1885, Hidaka Tōkichirō and Kawamura Takami co-founded the 'Bunbu Kōshūkan,' the predecessor to Seijō Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 1885年，河村隆实与日高藤吉郎共同创办了成城学校的前身“文武讲习馆”。
description.en: In 1885, Kawamura Takami and Hidaka Tōkichirō co-founded the 'Bunbu Kōshūkan,' the predecessor to Seijō Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军参谋本部支持了东京振武学校的创办和运营。
description.en: The Japanese Army General Staff supported the establishment and operation of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军参谋本部高官川上操六曾担任成城学校校长。
description.en: Kawakami Sōroku, a high-ranking officer of the Japanese Army General Staff, served as the principal of Seijō Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军参谋本部高官儿玉源太郎曾担任成城学校校长。
description.en: Kodama Gentarō, a high-ranking officer of the Japanese Army General Staff, served as the principal of Seijō Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 在日本留学生与清朝公使馆发生冲突后，福岛安正出面斡旋，促成了专门接收中国留学生的东京振武学校的成立。
description.en: After a conflict arose between Chinese students in Japan and the Qing legation, Fukushima Yasumasa mediated, leading to the establishment of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō specifically for Chinese students.

description.zh-cn: 在日本留学生与清朝公使馆发生冲突后，东亚同文会出面斡旋，促成了专门接收中国留学生的东京振武学校的成立。
description.en: After a conflict arose between Chinese students in Japan and the Qing legation, the East Asian Common Culture Society mediated, leading to the establishment of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō specifically for Chinese students.

description.zh-cn: 1898年，湖广总督张之洞选送4名学生入成城学校学习军事。
description.en: In 1898, Zhang Zhidong, the Viceroy of Huguang, selected and sent four students to study military science at Seijō Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 1899年起，南洋大臣刘坤一开始选派留学生入成城学校学习。
description.en: Starting in 1899, Liu Kunyi, the Viceroy of Liangjiang, began to select and send students to study at Seijō Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 1899年起，四川总督岑春煊开始选派留学生入成城学校学习。
description.en: Starting in 1899, Cen Chunxuan, the Viceroy of Sichuan, began to select and send students to study at Seijō Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 1899年起，直隶总督袁世凯开始选派留学生入成城学校学习。
description.en: Starting in 1899, Yuan Shikai, the Viceroy of Zhili, began to select and send students to study at Seijō Gakkō.

description.zh-cn: 1902年，清朝驻日公使蔡钧拒绝在钮瑷等九名自费生的担保书上盖章，阻止他们入学。
description.en: In 1902, Cai Jun, the Qing minister to Japan, refused to stamp the guarantee documents for nine self-funded students, including Niu Ai, preventing their enrollment.

description.zh-cn: 1903年7月东京振武学校成立后，原成城学校军事部的清朝留学生全部转入该校学习，东京振武学校实际承接了其对华军事预备教育的功能。
description.en: After the establishment of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō in July 1903, all Qing dynasty students from the military department of Seijō Gakkō were transferred to the new school, which effectively took over the function of preparatory military education for Chinese students.

description.zh-cn: 东京振武学校的毕业生可进入日本陆军士官学校留学生班就读。
description.en: Graduates of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō were eligible to enroll in the international student class of the Imperial Japanese Army Academy.

description.zh-cn: 成城学校旨在培训有志报考陆军士官学校的青年，其毕业生可进入该校学习。
description.en: Seijō Gakkō aimed to train young men aspiring to enter the Army Academy, and its graduates were eligible for admission.

description.zh-cn: 东京振武学校的旧址现为东京女子医科大学的所在地。
description.en: The former site of the Tokyo Shinbu Gakkō is now the location of the Tokyo Women's Medical University.
